description: Irish cuid oíche (“night's supper”) or cóisir (“banquet; festive party”).

verbs.description: cosher (third-person singular simple present coshers, present participle coshering, simple past and past participle coshered)

entries.meaning: To levy certain exactions or tribute upon; to lodge and eat at the expense of.
To treat with fondness; to excessively dote on.
To chat in a friendly way.
